title: Figma Buzz Introduces Three Powerful Features to Streamline Brand Asset Creation

paragraphs.content: Figma has announced three new features for Figma Buzz designed to enhance how marketing and brand teams create on-brand assets at scale. The updates include **configurable templates built on design systems**, **plugin integrations** for digital asset management and translation, and **in-app video trimming capabilities**. These features aim to deepen customization and control while keeping assets aligned with brand guidelines. The announcements represent Figma's response to user feedback requesting greater flexibility in template management and asset creation workflows.

paragraphs.content: Figma Buzz, currently available in free beta, serves as a dedicated tool for brand and marketing teams to create social media posts, digital ads, and event promotional materials without requiring extensive design expertise. The platform bridges the gap between designers who establish design systems and marketers who need quick, compliant asset variations. Since launching in open beta, Figma has continuously expanded Buzz's capabilities with video import/export functionality, team library connections, and Unsplash stock image integration. These three new features build on that foundation by addressing specific workflow pain points in asset customization and production.

sections.title: Design Systems Meet Marketing: Configurable Templates and Component Properties

paragraphs.content: The first major feature allows teams to **set up and publish templates using component properties**, enabling marketers to browse and switch between flexible template variations without managing hundreds of separate files. Brand designers can copy templates created in Figma Design using component sets and properties, then paste them into Figma Buzz where those properties automatically function. This connection to underlying design systems ensures that every customization remains on-brand while reducing the friction of template selection. The "Change layout" panel lets collaborators choose layout variants using dropdowns, toggle elements on and off, or swap approved instances with minimal effort.

paragraphs.content: This approach transforms how marketing teams interact with design systems, moving them from passive consumers to active customizers. Rather than requesting new template variations from designers, marketers can independently adjust layouts, colors, logos, and calls-to-action within pre-approved guardrails. Designer Advocate Kaitie Chambers demonstrated this workflow in a video showing how component properties enable faster, more flexible asset creation while maintaining content integrity. The system strikes a balance between creative control and brand consistency, addressing a longstanding challenge in scaling asset production.

sections.title: Extending Capability: Plugins and Integrated Workflows for Global Teams

paragraphs.content: Figma Buzz now supports **plugin integrations** that connect directly to digital asset management (DAM) systems, translation management systems (TMS), and animation tools, eliminating the need to switch between applications. Teams can pull brand-approved images from DAM platforms without leaving Figma, ensuring consistency while reducing context switching. Product Designer Natasha Tenggoro demonstrated how plugins enable inserting brand logos, QR codes, localizing assets, and adding animationsâ€”all within the Buzz interface. Beyond pre-built plugins for tools like Brandfolder, Lokalise, and LottieFiles, teams can create and publish internal plugins for use across their organization or share them with the broader Figma Community.

paragraphs.content: Translation management system integration proves particularly valuable for global marketing teams scaling campaigns across multiple languages and regions. Rather than manually copying translated copy into templates, teams can pull localized content directly from their TMS, facilitating cross-functional collaboration and keeping design context intact. Animation plugins enable teams to bring assets to life by adding motion to headlines, creating eye-catching visuals, or mimicking on-screen interactions without leaving the canvas. This integrated approach fundamentally changes how distributed teams collaborate on branded content, consolidating multiple tool switches into a single unified workspace.
